title: Here's the biggest news you missed this weekend
description: Maui wildfires, Hawaii, Hurricane Hilary, Tropical Storm Hilary, weather, FIFA Women's World Cup, Rudy Giuliani, Taylor Swift, TikTok, Eras Tour, 2024 Olympics

title: California store owner, mother of nine, fatally shot over a Pride flag displayed in her shop
description: A business owner was fatally shot on Friday after someone allegedly took issue with a Pride flag she had displayed at her clothing store in Lake Arrowhead, California.

title: Unseen in life, invisible in death: Many Maui homeless residents still missing
description: Many Maui homeless residents still missing nearly two weeks after wildfires burned Lahaina, Hawaii, to the ground.

title: Teen who murdered boyfriend in 100 mph crash had toxic relationship with him, prosecutors said
description: Mackenzie Shirilla, the Ohio teenager who intentionally crashed her car into a brick wall at 100 mph, will be sentenced Monday for murdering her boyfriend and friend.

title: Biden’s infrastructure building boom is missing one thing: Workers
description: President Joe Biden's plan to build out the nation's infrastructure is missing a key element: workers.

title: 'A fallen hero': Rudy Giuliani faces the music
description: Giuliani has been charged with engaging in a conspiracy to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election on behalf of Trump — a fall from his time as a respected prosecutor and mayor.

title: LIVE BLOG
description: The latest news on the final game of the FIFA Women’s World Cup starring England and Spain. This is the first championship appearance for both teams.

title: LIVE BLOG
description: Forecasters warn of life-threatening flooding as Hurricane Hilary, a dangerous Category 1 storm, roars towards the southwestern U.S.

title: Material to be applied in Maui burn zone to stop contaminated run-off
description: With more of the burn zone searched each day, the charred black earth and ash will soon turn pink as a “water-based glue” is applied to prevent winds and rain from kicking it up and running off into the ocean.
